dcterms:creator: N. Zhao
H. Dutta
S. Biswas
dcterms:description: The Zipf distribution is used to model content popularity, where the popularity of a content is proportional to the inverse of its rank.
dcterms:title: Zipf Distribution

dcterms:creator: A. K. Bhuyan
H. Dutta
S. Biswas
dcterms:description: The exponential distribution is used to model the inter-request time from a user, representing the time between requests for content.
dcterms:title: Exponential Distribution

dcterms:creator: A. K. Bhuyan
H. Dutta
S. Biswas
dcterms:description: The Smith-Waterman distance is used to measure the similarity between two sequences, particularly in the context of content popularity sequences.
dcterms:title: Smith-Waterman Distance

dcterms:creator: W. Cohen
et al.
dcterms:description: The Jaro-Winkler similarity is a measure used to compute the similarity between two sequences, particularly useful for matching names and records.
dcterms:title: Jaro-Winkler Similarity
